name: Roasted Dates Stuffed with Pine Nuts in Honey
author: Colleen
summary: From the volumes of Apicius, this splendid yet curious ancient dish from 1st century A.D. Roman brings together the tastes of honey, fruit, and nuts that can be served as a dessert after dinner.
ingredients: ½ cup white wine, or as needed
¼ cup honey, or as needed
2 cups dates - pitted and cut lengthwise to the center
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Soak pine nuts in a bowl with white wine and 1/4 cup honey to infuse flavor, at least 30 minutes
Mix Gorgonzola cheese and pine nuts together in a bowl
Spread dates open slightly; season the inside of each date with black pepper
Spoon Gorgonzola mixture into each date
Season the outside of each date with salt
Arrange stuffed dates in a baking dish
Bake in the preheated oven until warmed, about 10 minutes
Transfer cooked dates to a serving platter
